title: grpc build failed
body:
`# spack install -v grpc` will fail:

1. It looks some cmake configure cannot match the newest version.
There are lots of error log like that:
```
CMake Error at CMakeLists.txt:12658 (add_executable):
  Target "gen_hpack_tables" links to target "absl::inlined_vector" but the
  target was not found.  Perhaps a find_package() call is missing for an
  IMPORTED target, or an ALIAS target is missing?
```

2. After I remove the configure defined in grpc package.py, another error printed:
```
1 error found in build log:
     17    CMake Warning at cmake/abseil-cpp.cmake:30 (message):
     18      gRPC_ABSL_PROVIDER is "module" but ABSL_ROOT_DIR is wrong
     19    Call Stack (most recent call first):
     20      CMakeLists.txt:188 (include)
     21
     22
  >> 23    CMake Error at cmake/cares.cmake:25 (add_subdirectory):
     24      The source directory
     25
     26        /tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-grpc-1.27.3-evg7ynhx2wavbgdw7ri5nh4vbac4wo26/spack-src/third_party/cares/cares
     27
     28      does not contain a CMakeLists.txt file.
     29    Call Stack (most recent call first):

See build log for details:
  /tmp/root/spack-stage/spack-stage-grpc-1.27.3-evg7ynhx2wavbgdw7ri5nh4vbac4wo26/spack-build-out.txt
```

After searching on grpc github , it looks like some third-party repo should been clone before we build it by using this command:
`# git submodule update --init`

So I think maybe the grpc package should be refine for the latest version.
And because of the `git command`, maybe it's better to use `git = xxx` instead of `url =xxx` ?

And that's my local patch for testing
```
diff --git a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/grpc/package.py b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/grpc/package.py
index 8cbfe7732..df04c69ab 100644
--- a/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/grpc/package.py
+++ b/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/grpc/package.py
@@ -9,39 +9,27 @@ class Grpc(CMakePackage):
     """A high performance, open-source universal RPC framework."""

     homepage = "https://grpc.io"
-    url      = "https://github.com/grpc/grpc/archive/v1.27.0.tar.gz"
+    git      = "https://github.com/grpc/grpc.git"

-    version('1.27.0', sha256='3ccc4e5ae8c1ce844456e39cc11f1c991a7da74396faabe83d779836ef449bce')
-    version('1.26.0', sha256='2fcb7f1ab160d6fd3aaade64520be3e5446fc4c6fa7ba6581afdc4e26094bd81')
-    version('1.25.0', sha256='ffbe61269160ea745e487f79b0fd06b6edd3d50c6d9123f053b5634737cf2f69')
-    version('1.24.3', sha256='c84b3fa140fcd6cce79b3f9de6357c5733a0071e04ca4e65ba5f8d306f10f033')
-    version('1.23.1', sha256='dd7da002b15641e4841f20a1f3eb1e359edb69d5ccf8ac64c362823b05f523d9')
+    version('master', branch='master')

-    variant('codegen', default=True,
+    variant('codegen', default=False,
             description='Builds code generation plugins for protobuf '
                         'compiler (protoc)')

-    depends_on('protobuf')
     depends_on('openssl')
-    depends_on('zlib')
-    depends_on('c-ares')
+
+    root_cmakelists_dir = 'cmake/build'

     def cmake_args(self):
         args = [
             '-DgRPC_BUILD_CODEGEN:Bool={0}'.format(
                 'ON' if '+codegen' in self.spec else 'OFF'),
-            '-DgRPC_BUILD_CSHARP_EXT:Bool=OFF',
-            '-DgRPC_INSTALL:Bool=ON',
-            # Tell grpc to skip vendoring and look for deps via find_package:
-            '-DgRPC_CARES_PROVIDER:String=package',
-            '-DgRPC_ZLIB_PROVIDER:String=package',
-            '-DgRPC_SSL_PROVIDER:String=package',
-            '-DgRPC_PROTOBUF_PROVIDER:String=package',
-            '-DgRPC_USE_PROTO_LITE:Bool=OFF',
-            '-DgRPC_PROTOBUF_PACKAGE_TYPE:String=CONFIG',
-            # Disable tests:
-            '-DgRPC_BUILD_TESTS:BOOL=OFF',
-            '-DgRPC_GFLAGS_PROVIDER:String=none',
-            '-DgRPC_BENCHMARK_PROVIDER:String=none',
         ]
         return args
+
+    def cmake(self, spec, prefix):
+        git=which('git')
+        git('submodule', 'update', '--init')
+        mkdirp('cmake/build/')
+        cmake('cmake/build')
```
